column4: Hi! I'm trying to install shotwell 0.8+ on Lucid but without success for now. I've added yorba's and felxio-something's too. No help.
Any idea? Btw, is there any other app for image collections with video support?
picasa maybe?
picasa doesn't play videos on GNU/Linux AFAIK.
ok... what version of shotwell do you have, and you're trying to install .8?
current version is 0.7.2 from yorba's ppa, and I'm looking for 0.8 or 0.9.
0.8 should have video support too.
btw, I can install it from source, but...
well, looking at their instructions, the yorba repository for .9 only works w/ maverick... so.. thats why its not working... unless you find another repo, your only option is to compile from source
ok... do I have to remove current shotwell before compiling it?
wait, have yout ried the "flexion" PPA, and it still didn't work?
yeah. Still nothing.
that would probably be a good idea...
ok...
you can probably back up /home/user/.shotwell  if you want to save your configuration.
great idea. :D

there's instructions here for backing up shotwell, etc.. i would do that, then uninstall it, then compile from source.. http://trac.yorba.org/wiki/Shotwell/FAQ#CanIrunShotwell0.9.0onUbuntu10.04LucidLynx
they also have instructions on that site for compiling it from source...
gentoo user here, don't worry. :D
then why are you here
because my father uses ubuntu. :D
